header.title: Lingonberry Macarons
captions: These macarons are the perfect snack for your afternoon teas and small get togethers!
Prep time: 20 minutes | Wait time: 1-2 hours | Cook Time: 20 minutes | Total Time: 1 hour 40 minutes – 2 hours 40 minutes

list: o 25 g egg whites (about ½ egg)
1. Place the egg whites in a bowl.
2. Add the sugar into the egg whites.

3. Use a hand mixer or a stand mixer to beat the egg whites and sugar together. (Start slow to melt the sugar, then use the middle speed to whip until the larger bubbles disappear. Finally, use the fastest speed until the egg whites reach stiff peaks.
4. Sift in half of the almond flour and powdered sugar.
5. Use the slowest speed on the mixer to incorporate everything before sifting in the remaining half of almond flour and powdered sugar.
6. Continue to mix until there is a slow ribbon that forms when the whisk is lifted.
7. Transfer the mixture to a piping bag with a circular tip.
8. Pipe the macarons onto a piece of parchment paper on a baking tray (Print out a macaron template online for consistent macaron shells).

9. Drop the tray from a few inches off the ground or counter to get rid of any air bubbles in the macarons. Repeat several times. (If there are still air bubbles, use a toothpick to gently remove them.)

10. Let the macarons rest for about an hour. (This waiting period depends on the humidity in your area.) The macarons will be ready when the tops become matte. Lightly run a finger over the tops and if the macarons are dry, they're ready to be put in the oven.
12. Lower the heat to 90 °C (195 °F) and place the macarons in the oven for 2-3 minutes. Leave the oven door slightly open for a little more drying.
13. Close the oven door and set the heat to 140 °C (285 °F).
15. Let the macarons cool on a wire rack.
